meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of atheism.
meanings.sent1: Her atheistical views led to many philosophical discussions.
meanings.sent2: The atheistical group met every Sunday to discuss their beliefs.
meanings.sent3: Despite his atheistical nature, he always respected others' religious beliefs.
meanings.sent4: The painting depicted a world devoid of color, a metaphor for the atheistical society.
meanings.sent5: The atheistical philosophy was as clear as the bright sky on a sunny day.

meanings.definition: Holding the belief that there is no God.
meanings.sent1: The atheistical professor challenged his students to think critically about religion.
meanings.sent2: She had an atheistical upbringing but later found solace in spirituality.
meanings.sent3: The atheistical cat refused to believe in the existence of a higher power.
meanings.sent4: His atheistical mindset was like a fortress against any religious influence.
meanings.sent5: The atheistical argument was as strong as a mountain, unyielding to any opposing views.
